intro: Euphrasia pulchra, commonly known as the pretty eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of two lips, with the upper lip being shorter than the lower one. Euphrasia pulchra is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions.
